Properties.Threshold_Behavior: Risk drops rapidly after critical intervention period

Properties.Interaction_Effects: Nutrients influence absorption of other nutrients

Properties.Adaptation_Response: System develops resistance to interventions over time
Properties.Periodic_Variation: Efficiency follows circadian and ultrarapidian rhythms
Properties.Threshold_Effects: Sudden changes occur at critical parameter values

Properties.Multi-parameter_Integration: Health state depends on all biometric parameters
Properties.Temporal_Derivatives: Rate of change affects overall health prediction
Properties.Historical_Integration: Cumulative deviation from optimal values impacts health

Variables.F(i,t): Fitness parameter i at time t

Properties.Supercompensation: Fitness improves above baseline after recovery
Properties.Diminishing_Returns: Gains decrease with higher baseline fitness
Properties.Recovery_Dependence: Optimal improvement requires adequate recovery periods

Properties.Stage_Importance: Deep sleep and REM have highest coefficients
Properties.Circadian_Synchronization: Quality maximized when sleep aligns with circadian rhythm
Properties.Disruption_Sensitivity: Small disruptions cause disproportionate quality reduction

Longevity_Function.Formula: L(t) = L₀ - ∫[S(τ) - R(τ)]dτ from 0 to t

Properties.Repair_Capacity: Body's ability to repair damage decreases with age
Properties.Intervention_Window: Critical periods exist where interventions have maximum impact

Properties.Exponential_Dynamics: Without treatment, many diseases progress exponentially
Properties.Treatment_Threshold: Minimum effectiveness required to halt progression
Properties.Resistance_Development: Treatment effectiveness may decrease over time

Properties.Multi-dimensional_State: Health represented as vector in multi-parameter space
Properties.Intervention_Synergy: Combined interventions may have greater than additive effects
Properties.Homeostatic_Resistance: System resists change proportional to deviation from baseline
